Name: Proch i Stal
Description:
"Proch i Stal" (Gunpowder and Steel) is a cooperative board game based on events that took place in 1771-1772 in and around a benedictine monastery located near Cracow (Tyniec). A group of confederates (rebelling against Russian influence in Poland) gained control of the monastery and turned it into fortress. Attacked both by Russian armies they managed to hold Tyniec and to organize numerous attacks on nearby areas. Probably the most amazing of those is conquest of Wawel castle (confederates managed to enter it via old sewer tunnel and took its Russian garrison by surprise).

In the game players take on the roles of officers of confederate forces. Their task is to hold the fortress for specified number of turns (based on difficulty level). They need to organize food for soldiers, support the garrison of Wawel castle, try to keep decent morale among the confederates and most of all prevent casualties among their units. If at any point during the game Tyniec will be left without units to defend it the fortress falls and players loose. Cooperation, planing and a bit of luck is what it takes to win the game.

Player's turn consist of two things. First you draw an event card that will have two effects - one it will control the movement of the Russian forces (reinforcements, advance or press attack on Wawel), second will be actual positive or negative event (that often will give a players choice whether to accept consequences like loosing units, food, morale or discard action cards as a group). Next the player will have a chance to act by playing action card - actions include organizing reinforcement for Wawel, bringing food to the fortress, fighting with Russian units etc. After 4 players turns an upkeep phase occurs - food is needed for soldiers, moral is checked and Russians forces strom the Tyniec.

Name: Rugby
Description:
Subtitled "Ein amerikanisches Kampfspiel" ("an American combat game").

An abstract strategy game where you try to bring ten of your fourteen 'players' into the opponent's touchdown zone.

On your turn, you may move one of your field player gaming pieces forward one space - never backwards. You may jump over one enemy field player, thus not only moving one more space, but also gaining another turn. One of your pieces is called the goalie; he may only move sidewards and no other piece may jump over him. He is used to block enemy field players who want to enter your touchdown zone.

Name: Multicards
Description:
A collection of 6 card games playable with the same 52 card deck:

CLASSICAL PLAYING CARDS: use the cards as any other poker deck

CARD DICE: use the cards for any dice game you like

SOCCER TOTO: use the cards to determine the outcome of a soccer match (0 = draw, 1 = win home team, 2 = win away team)

LOTTO: use the cards to simulate a lottery with numbers from 1 to 49

ROULETTE: use the cards to simulate a spin on a roulette wheel with numbers from 0 to 36

SLOT MACHINE: use the cards to simulate a slot machine with cherries, lemons, $$$s, BARs, etc.

Name: Mampf!
Description:
A fun game about fast food.
Players try to eat at the worst fast food joint in town: "Dieter's Grill Express". But before they can do this, they have to prove that they can produce and digest the greasiest fast food. 
On your turn, you throw the dice and move that number of spaces. 
If you land on a grey space, every other player but you has to eat at your fast food joint: on a menu table, fast food is selected via a d20 roll. This culinary sensation has now to be digested: the table gives a health number, added is a d6 roll, the player's experience level and various modifiers from cards. If the modified result is higher than that health number, the player gains experience. If he rolls lower, he is taken to the hospital and misses his next turn.
The more experience the players gather, the harder will the menue tables become, but to win, you have to collect at least 30 points to finally eat at "Dieter's" and win the game.
Other spaces help players on their quest, like "Restaurant" where you can eat proper food and gain more health (aka die roll modifiers), "Doctor" where you can avoid the next hospital result, or "Toilet", where you can get all that grease out of your system and increase your health number.

Name: Das Österreich-Spiel
Description:
A trivial game with 990 questions about Austria.

The game board shows Austria, divided in 32 squares. Every square has a matching tile; tiles are drawn when a player takes his turn. On his turn he also has to answer a question about Austria, drawn from the deck of trivia cards. If he answers correctly, he puts that tile on the corresponding space on the board and moves his pawn forward. As soon as all tiles are on the board, the game is over and the player whose pawn has advanced the most spaces is the winner. 
Special tiles award extra points or penalties to the drawing player. There are two types of questions - the blue ones are easy and the red ones are hard. Players have to agree which set they want to use.

Name: Heads Up!
Description:
This is a memory type game with a 3 x 3 board with 9 heads. Each player gets a set of 9 cards representing the 9 heads.

On each turn, everyone except the switcher covers their eyes.  The switcher then moves 2 heads around.  The players open their eyes and take the cards out of their set they think were switched.  If they get both right, they get 2 tokens.  One right gets 1 token, and none right gets no tokens.  An agreed upon number of tokens wins the game (the rules suggest 5).

Name: Superpfeife
Description:
Get the stadion's atmosphere into your living room.
Try to to predict the referee's decisions before him while watching a soccer game. Who best forecasts them wins the game.

The game is played while watching a soccer game. Each player gets a whistle, a red card, and a yellow card, and tries to use them, anticipating the referee.

Every time the referee decides the same way as a player, the player gets bonus points, otherwise minus points. Who has the most points at the end of the soccer game wins.

Name: Rules for the Great War (1914-1915)
Description:
A booklet with tabletop rules. It contains all necessary rules and tables to simulate actions from early World War I with 15mm miniatures.

The various chapters of the booklet contain:

Game scale: 1 figure represents 50 infantry men; 1 MG with crew equals 1 MG with crew, and 2 ordnance pieces equal 1 battery consisting of 12 men and 4 horses.

Movement rules cover all kinds of hindrances, chances of mechanical failure when moving motorized units, and unit formations.

Morale rules cover all kinds of movement under fire, behaviour under fire and regrouping; every possible situation is handled by employing various dice roll modifiers.

Combat covers basically two situations: fire combat for rifles and MGs and artillery. Both types of combat are handled by rolling 2 dice and employing various modifiers for movement, cover, unit quality, etc. Damage is then determined by a dice roll on a table using the result calculated above.

Melee combat covers special actions between infantry vs. infantry as well as infantry vs. cavalry and cavalry vs. cavalry. Retreats and advances are possible in melee.

The last pages of the book show the organisation of the British Expeditionary Force and the Imperial German Army.

The center of the book contains a removable sheet with all necessary tables and modifiers for easy reference during play.

Name: Das Testament des Gottfried von Bouillon
Description:
An adventure game where players try to find a legendary wine barrel in the ruins of a castle. The game is based on the adventure comic with the same name from Yves Chaland. Each player represents a character from that comic.
On your turn, you roll the dice and move that number of spaces. The space you land is either blank (and the next player takes his turn); it on contains an event (like miss one turn, roll the die and move that more spaces, pay a fine, etc.); or it contains a color and a symbol. In the latter case, the player consults his character booklet and looks up the page with the corresponding color and symbol. A short story there is read and and the player has to decide what to do next: the booklet gives two or more choices and each choice corresponds to a numbered paragraph in the rule book, which is looked up and carried out. 
These paragraphs are the heart of the game and the key to victory. The rule book also suggests that you read the comic book to understand the game and the story better.

Name: Space Attack!
Description:
A semi-cooperative game of action and intrigue with the fate of Earth hanging in the balance!

Earth is facing a massive alien assault.  With only three cards in your hand, with four choices on each card, you will lead your nation to victory... or defeat.  You and your opponent's choices determine whether Earth lives or dies.  The winner is the player who can swing the pendulum of fate in their favor during Earth's gravest hour... the Space Attack!

Space Attack! is a simple to print and quick to play "print and play game".  All you need are a few sheets of paper, a black & white printer and a pair of scissors.

Name: Ambit
Description: AMBIT® has all the elements players like in a board game. You control your own fate. No early eliminations. Players decide on each turn whether to roll the dice, pick a card or play a card from their hand! No two games are ever the same! Every player has a chance to win until the very end. AMBIT® will provide hours of fun as you try to outwit and outmaneuver your opponents. Decision making is key on every move. AMBIT® is played with 2 to 6 players, individually or in teams. The box says ages 12 to adult, however, it can be played by anyone who can read and reason. AMBIT®  was entirely made in Buffalo (NY), with the exception of pawns and dice. They were acquired from a U.S. company who made the pawns but not the dice. Estimated play time: 30 to 90 minutes.

Name: Deception Dice
Description:
Deception Dice is a updated version of the classic pirate dice game aka Liar's Dice but with a unique feature which are the Deception Dice cubes. This is a game of strategy, luck and a bit of deception. Players must strategically blend honesty with deception when making bets for each hand as each player is at risk to lose their dice during game play. Ultimately, the dice, once revealed, will decide the winner.

The Deception Dice cubes get rolled into the "pit" to set the format of play for each hand. The red DD cube defines the number of dice at risk to the loser of the hand (i.e. 1 die or 2 dice). The green DD cube establishes the format of play (i.e. NL - No Look hand, R - reverse direction, Star - extra wild in play, etc.). The red DD indicator is bad luck (roller loses a die) and the green DD indicator is good luck (roller gets to return a previously lost die to their hand). Rolling double DD's has a special consequence! All players shake their colored dice in their shaker cup and throw down keeping their dice concealed from the others. Ones are wild and a player's turn requires a bet to be made which is based upon all the dice in play. Bets will continue to be increased until a player challenges another players bet. Once the dice get revealed, the bettor or caller will lose dice.

The goal of the game is to be the last player with at least a single die. Wagering can be incorporated into the game.

Name: Buzzword Bits
Description: Buzzword Bits miniature version of Buzzword in which players compete to give answers to five clues that all have a certain two-letter combination in common.  For example, answers to the combination "MW" might be "Monkey Wrench" or "Most Wanted" - whatever fits the clue!  It consists only of a deck of cards and is great for travel.

Name: Le Synapse
Description:
Le Synapse is a two-player abstract game played 4×4 square board.  It was designed to be played with materials commonly found at home:  Draw the 4×4 board on paper, making the spaces large enough to host matches.  The first player places one to three matches in a space, pointing orthogonally at another empty space on the board.  This is where the second player must place matches.  This continues until someone can't play legally, and loses the game.

As a variant, you can limit the supply of matches to just 25, which means the supply could become insufficient to allow a legal play.

Name: Fantail Rugby
Description:
You will be protagonist of a new and realistic Rugby Board Game where the different situations that this vibrant sport presents, are intertwined by means of smart charts. Fantail Rugby is an agile and dynamic Board Game that combines all the action of Rugby within the rules that govern. Fantail Rugby allows you to make (one or two) handed pass, line outs, scrums, kicks, tackles, mauls, rucks, tries, penalties and drops, besides other actions inherent to the Rugby Game. Fantail Rugby combines action, strategy and luck.

About Fantail Rugby Board Game
Fantail Rugby is played by two coaches who must lead their teams to the victory. The smart charts are the soul of the game by having each of them a special design to be used according to game development. On the game board can clearly see the current situation of the game that is taking place in the smart chart in use, because the symbols of the board are in accordance with the symbols of the smart charts.

Attention:

New updated version (2020) of the most entertaining and agile Rugby Game you have ever seen.
Now, smart cards have focused on an even more dynamic game by being designed to simulate a Seven Rugby Game . In addition, the images have been improved and the chances of reaching the try or a conversion are more common.

Teams can be made up of one player, two or three and the playing time is agreed in advance. The fact of being played with an eight-sided dice has a lot of random, but since smart cards have the possibility of deciding in various game situations, it gives to the same a touch of strategy which will depend on the score and the remaining playing time.

Name: Ramses Rage
Description:
Ramses II reigned over Ancient Egypt for 67 years. Today, you can shake the tomb, but beware of his rage.

This game is played with six standard dice and one multi-colored pyramid.  The object of the game is to reach 10,000 points. Points are acquired by rolling the dice and the pyramid.

Each player rolls the dice and tries to earn as many points as possible in each turn.  A highly successful roll or set of rolls allows the player the option of throwing the pyramid.

Name: ProBingo
Description:
Every player has one bingo card.
Then they roll 2 dice & move around the central play board in the same direction as the arrows. Everybody uses the Number you stop on. 
The first to make any full line wins! Two or more winners split the winnings. Play for Fun or decide on a Jackpot to play for in the middle.

Name: Gewußt wo!
Description: This is a memory game where each image exists four times. Players may flip up to four cards if they know all the places. You also get more points if you find three instead of two.

Name: Colorado Smith et le Sacré Temple
Description:
Colorado Smith and the Sacred Temple is a tongue-in-cheek boardgame adaptation of popular pulp adventure movies like Indiana Jones. An evil priest wants to sacrifice a virgin priestess of the forces of Light to his deity (some unspeakable horror with tentacles of course). Just like in the movies, the players reach the ceremonial altar just in time to prevent the sacrifice, but each of them has different goals.

The game can be played with three or six players (in which case there are two of each character). The game characters are an adventurer, whose first objective is to steal the jewels embedded in the idols and his second to rescue the princess, an avenger (whose first goal is to kill the priest, then to steal the jewels) and the father of the priestess (whose goal is to save his daughter, then to kill the priest). Each character gains victory points according to his goals, the player with the most victory points win. Each character also has different stats and equipment.

During a game turn, the priest is moved on the board, then players move and fight, then if a player's character or a dead body is in the line of sight of the priest or a cultist, the player roll a die and consult a table indicating what happens (the cultists may move or shoot arrows, the priest may try to possess one of the characters for one more turns).

The game ends when all the characters are either dead or have left the board.

The game was published in Casus Belli magazine issue #23: Casus Belli (Issue 23 - Dec 1984)

Name: Peur sur Irka
Description:
The planet Irka has been devastated by a worldwide war. Only 5 cities remain, each protected by a force field powered by a nuclear reactor. Each player must destroy the opposing cities' generators while protecting her own.

The game uses a standard card deck. Each turn, players move their forces on the board, then attack enemy territory. Combat strength is computed by adding the number of fighting pieces, the point value of a random card and another card from the the player's hand; highest combat strength wins and can occupy the defender's position, the defender withdraws to an adjacent position, or is eliminated if retreat is impossible. If a player has a pair in her hand, she can play it to gain additional advantages (for example a pair of threes allow a player to take control of an opponent piece for this combat).

The game was published in Casus Belli magazine, issue #24: Casus Belli (Issue 24 - Feb 1985)

Name: Hot Wheels Races
Description:
Imagine you're a race driver. You are competing in the eliminations and are determined to win the season round. To be victorious, you must demonstrate excellent memory and respond instantly to the continual changes on the track.
(from publisher's blurb)

Card game based on HotWheels license. You react to the road cards by playing appropriate maneuver card - but you have to remember where you put it, as they're laying face down.

Name: Fleets
Description:
"FLEETS is a fleet-scale combat game simulating tactical warfare between fleets on a squadron level. Players can take command of fleets as small as a frigate group to as large as an entire battlefleet! These three units contain the rules, the pieces, and the charts needed to play the basic game."

A game design concepted and constructed in the span of a week, FLEETS was one of my senior project designs from CSU East Bay in 2009. It is currently undergoing testing, balancing, and mid-level development and I'm seeking a publisher.

FLEETS is an abstract game of space warfare with fleet numbers measuring into the hundreds. Not quite a board game but not quite a miniatures game, FLEETS straddles both lines and is simple enough to complete a session in under a half hour. Several expansions are planned once it takes off.

Name: Hot Wheels Motorsports
Description:
You are on a truly hot ride. Hop into the supercar and... give it a kick!!! Just check if it's fuelled up and there's no traffic jam on the way. Whoever is first to have tried all the cars, wins the game.
(from publisher's blurb)

Card game based on HotWheels license. Get rid of your cards first by playing cards following the color of model of the car depicted. Watch out for special function cards.

Name: Hot Wheels Highway
Description:
Do you dream of speeding up and getting an unforgettable thrill? Set off with us! Change your cars and drive on, straight to victory.
(from publisher's blurb)

Card game based on HotWheels license. Get rid of all of your cards by playing them in numerical sequence. You may play more of the same-value cards simultaneously. If you cannot play, draw 3 new cards.

Name: Spacego
Description:
Spacego is a science fiction wargame in the general mold of Space Hulk, although significantly less complex. A large alien ship is approaching Earth with unknown intentions. Two to four players are heroes who enter the ship with the objective of planting explosives to destroy it. Another player is the "master" of the ship who controls the aliens and tries to prevent the heroes from carrying out their mission.

The heroes and aliens each have individual record boards to track their attributes, which can change during play. Much of the game revolves around tables of positive and negative events which get rolled on for various reasons.

Unlike in some similar games, in Spacego the hero players can attack each other as well as the aliens.

Name: Magician's Cookbook
Description:
In Der verflixte Zaubertrank players are magician assistants who need to bring together the ingredients needed to complete potions – but to do this, they can use a little magic of their own to double up on ingredients they already have.

Each player has four cauldron tiles – two with slits in the top, two with slits in the bottom – that can be assembled into two cauldrons; a player also has two fireplace tiles on which the completed cauldrons sit as well as eight firestones. To set up the game, 22 magic ingredient tiles that show mushrooms, spiders, frogs and the assistants themselves are shuffled, placed into two even stacks, then covered with a "book" cover.

To start the first round, the book cover is "opened" so that four ingredient tiles are revealed (the "recipe"). Players then race to assemble their cauldrons and place them on their fireplaces; after doing so, they then rotate the fireplaces and mark the locations from which they can see the ingredients needed to complete the potion. The cauldrons tiles have mirrors on half of them, so a mushroom on one tile might be reflected in the mirror, thus giving a player two mushrooms for a potion. Similarly, a half mushroom can be made whole with a mirror.

Once a player thinks he has marked exactly the number and type of ingredients he needs, he ends the round. If he created the potion correctly, he moves his pawn two spaces on the track; otherwise everyone else advances one space on the track. Players then disassemble their cauldrons, flip over two ingredients tiles (thereby showing a new recipe), and start the next round.

If an assistant shows up on an ingredient tile, that player advances two spaces after cooking ends that round. At a certain point in the game, a mouse comes to aide the player in last place, providing all the mushrooms that player needs.

Der verflixte Zaubertrank ends when all recipes have been used or a player reaches the final space on the track. The player who advances the farthest on the track wins the game.

Name: 4 Kings
Description:
4 Kings is a card game for 2 to 7 players. It can be played with a standard deck of cards, or with the print & play cards (available in the links section).

The objective is to use the unique abilities of the cards you are dealt, (or the cards you choose, if using the Card Drafting variant) to capture other cards, while at the same time avoiding the loss of your own highest valued cards. If any player captures all 4 Kings, that player wins.

A player chosen at random will start out the game with a card of his choice. After this, each player attempts to use the abilities of their cards to capture opponents' cards in play while at the same time limiting the risk of losing their highest valued cards.

After playing a card, until the start of a player's next turn, his card is at risk of being captured. At the end of play, if no player has captured all 4 kings, the player holding the highest value of cards collected wins.

Name: Tout le monde veut prendre sa place
Description:
The board game from the French show of the same name on France 2 --
"Everyone wants to take his place"

The goal of the game is to earn points to challenge and defeat the champion in the final step of the game.

At the beginning of the game a player is selected to be the champion (or the champion of the previous game) and wait for an opponent.

During the first two steps of the game, other players answer series of questions and earn points to qualify them to the final.Players may choose to answer directly, or choose between four possible answers or between two possible answers, influencing the amount of points they earn.

In the third step of the game, the player with the most points faces the champion defeat him and take his place!

Name: Weird Tales
Description:
Will you be the first to finish in Weird Tales? It's a race to the end (card) as players pit their story skills against each other to emerge as the victorious storyteller!

Weird Tales is a storytelling game where players help to complete a story using cards in their hand. Every card will earn you points; the one with the most points at the end of the game is the winner!

Weird Tales is a storytelling card game for 3-6 players, aged 10 years and up. Earn turn, a player uses one of the five cards in his hand to contribute to the story being told. Players are awarded points based on the cards used each turn; points are tabulated at the end of the game. The winner is one with the most points!

Name: When The Navy Walked
Description:
When the Navy Walked is a miniature rules set that covers an alternate history from the 1872 Victorian era to the 1909 Edwardian Industrial Age.  It is a springboard for imagination and a high-level game of tactics and battles set amongst a 'what if' world inspired by the classic authors of Victorian Science Fiction and Retro Science Fiction.  In WTNW players take the reins of generals and command massive armies of steam driven behemoths.  In the end, the thunder that cascades across the battlefield to settle in the souls of the fighting men will only be assuaged with the assistance of the landship.

When the Navy Walked is the first in a series of books that will outline the story and history behind this alternate Earth, its culture and the rules for fighting massive battles.  In future supplements players will have the opportunity to play through various alternate historical scenarios, including the colonization of Africa and the deep, dark folds of the Aether.  So grab your goggles and your Aethertech and get ready for a good time filled with steam and adventure!

Name: Diplomacy: 1900 Variant
Description:
The balance of power between the seven Great Nations of Europe teeters precariously at the dawn of the 20th Century.  Take control of Austria-Hungary, Britain, France, Germany, Italy, Russia, or Turkey and lead your chosen nation to victory.  You will have to balance your expansion with carefully crafted alliances, knowing when to seize the advantage through a perfectly-timed stab while avoiding being stabbed yourself.

1900 is a variant of the classic game, Diplomacy.  Its core rules are the same, but the map has changed and been expanded in order to improve play balance, player interaction, and historical accuracy.

Players will find the familiar map expanded to include the rest of the Mediterranean, a passable Switzerland, passage through the Suez Canal, and overall more reflective of territorial lines of 1900 than 1913, what the original game map displayed.

This game is largely played over email with adjudication performed by an electronic judge.

Name: Executive Manager: A Manpower Game
Description:
Executive Manager- A Manpower Game

Executive Manager is a business game designed for 2 to 4 players. In the game the players are put in the position of a manager who must achieve a certain production by the end of a month. To achieve this output the player must maintain a staff of 5 workers.  His permanent staff consists of Mr. Noshow, Miss Tardy, Mr. Fumble, Miss Vacation, and Miss Sniffles.  When members of this rather unreliable staff are out they may be replaced with Manpower employees.

Game Equipment

Game Board in 3 Interlocking Sections
Employee Tokens (Noshow, Tardy, etc. and Manpower Personnel)
Dice
Play Money
Yellow Fortune Cards
Wooden Tokens
Market Price Cards

Name: Syntesis
Description:
Laboratory Syntesis! A team of researchers working on the study of new proteins. But a procedural error caused the Genetic Material discarded, were free to recombination with some types of dangerous viruses. Now, besides the study, researchers also must deal with the activation of these viruses and learn undoing the consequences of these activations, which may directly affect all searches. And in this context that best take advantage of the situation, the winner is ...
 In Syntesis, players will have to create one or more proteins. To do this you have to create a correct sequence of amino acids that determine each protein. For this, Nitrogen Bases Adenine, thymine, cytosine and guanine must be placed in proper sequence. But watch out, because viruses can be activated, which may interfere with the search for all players.

Name: Sigla: Ataque de blindados
Description:
This game has 6 tanks trying to be the last one alive on a board consisting of a 10x10 grid.

Each turn you select 3 of your 21 cards that will determine the three actions you are allowed to take that turn.
Move, retreat, turn, turn your turret or fire! 
Mountains and land mines post obstacles for your movement and fire, and you will have to try to deduce your opponent's moves, since you have to pick your cards at the same time.

Beware, if your tank is hit, you'll have to discard seven of those cards and wont have that much choices, get hit three times and you're out!


El juego consiste en 6 tanques intentando ser el último en pie en un tablero tipo grilla de 10x10.

Cada turno los jugadores eligen cuales 3 de los 21 movimientos posibles de su tanque van a realizar (avanzar, retroceder, girar, girar el cañon, disparar).
Hay montañas y minas que obstaculizan el desplazamiento, y un lindo juego de deducción al tener que adivinar los movimientos de tu oponente porque las cartas a usar se eligen al principio y se van ejecutando después en el orden del turno

Si golpean a tu tanque, tenés que descartar 7 de las 21 cartas de movimiento. Otro golpe y solo te quedarán 7 cartas, al tercer golpe el tanque es destruido!

Name: Powerplay
Description:
Powerplay is played on a 4x4 game board. Each player has 4 round-shaped and 4 square-shaped tokens numbered from 1 to 4. The tokens have two sides, one of them with a black frame. On a turn, a player places one of their tokens on a free space on the game board. When all spaces have been occupied, it's time to check the effects of each token on the opponent's neighboring tokens. The square tokens work horizontally and vertically whereas the round tokens work diagonally. A token is considered conquered if the score of the pieces surrounding it is higher than its own value. It is then turned onto its black framed side. The winner is the player with the most points (i.e., a higher difference between the points of the pieces they conquered and the points of your pieces conquered by the opponent).

Originally published in spielbox 1991 #6.

Name: Little Burro Chase Game
Description: One of the players plays the "Burros" and the other player tries to get them back into the "Corral", before they can reach the "Cave".  The player for the Burros, spins first, and spins 3 times for each Burro, moving them the amount of spaces indicated on the spinner.  From this point of the game, the Burros receive 1 spin for each marker, spinning for the leading marker first, second next, etc., and moves each forward the amount on the spinner.  After the Burros each have their turn, the other player spins again as before, moves all the Burros backwards the amount spun.  If a Burro moves back into the Corral, or if he lands on a space marked "Trap", remove this marker from the playing board.  if of the Burros reach the Cave, the Burros win the game.  If all of the Burros are caught, they lose the game.

Name: Aurora-opoly
Description:
According to the rules:

The Object of the game is to be the only player not to become bankrupt.

To Set Up the game each player chooses a token and begins on the start square.  Each player is given two each of the $500s, $100s and $50s; six of the $20s; five each of the $10s, $5s and $1s.  During the game the bank cannot go broke.  The bank sells and handles the bankruptcies of the businesses and charges for the customers.  If the bank runs out of customers, no more can be obtained until some are sold back to the bank.

To Win the game, a player has to be the only player not to declare personal bankruptcy.  When a player owes more money than he can raise by selling customers and bankrupting his businesses, he is out of the game.  Any bankrupt businesses a play has, goes to the persona or bank that he owes money to.  The player who receives the bankrupt businesses immediately has to pay the bankruptcy charge plus 10% for any business he wants to own.  If he does not pay the charges, the business goes back to the bank to be sold to anyone who lands on the square.  Players may trade and sell businesses between themselves.

Name: Monopoly: Pirates of the Caribbean On Stranger Tides Collector's Edition
Description:
A pirate adventure awaits you in this special Pirates of the Caribbean collector’s edition of the monopoly game featuring pirate destinations from the new movie, On Stranger Tides. Do you have what it takes to outwit and outlast the legendary Pirates of the Caribbean as you buy, sell and trade prominent movie locations including Blackbeard’s Cabin, WhiteCap Bay, St. James Palace and the deadly Mermaid Pools? The fate of the high seas lies in your hands as you battle for ultimate control of the Fountain of Youth.

Includes 6 collectible tokens: Jack Sparrow’s compass, Jack Voodoo Doll, Angelica’s Ring, The Fountain of Youth Chalice, Mermaid Coffin, Sword of Triton.

Name: Robot Explorers
Description: Navigate our wonderful solar system in a race to collect research specimens! Your robot might encounter asteroids and malfunctioning rocket parts, or have some of our galaxy’s finest (and friendliest) lend you a helping hand in this quest to beat the rest! Your Robot races round the sun to all eight planets - every one has specimens that you must grab for research in your rocket lab, the first player to fill their science shelf wins!

Name: Gathering a Garden
Description: On its adorable and happy game board, take a trip round to each vendor to gather some flowers, vegetables and more for your bounty of garden delights. Get your flower, herb and tree, vegetable and bird. (They're free!) Your garden is completely done? Get home first, and you have won!

Name: Thunder at the Crossroads: The Battle of Gettysburg
Description:
From the back of the box :

"On the evening of July 1st. 1863, George Gordon Meade mounted his horse for the short ride north to the small Pennsylvania town of Gettysburg. Fighting had broken out early that morning. Meade had shifted the assorted corps of the Army of the Potomac northward to that town. General Reynolds was reported down. Hancock had the field in hand (he hoped) and Meade was now moving his headquarters to that fateful field. In the few days since being thrust into command of the Army of the Potomac, Meade had gained full control and would now direct it toward what was to be its single most important battle.

Turning back R.E. Lee's second invasion of the North, Meade would end the Southern general's significant offensive capabilities. For the North. it was the beginning of the march which would eventually win the war."

Scale
Each hex on the game map equals 200 yards of real terrain. Each day-time turn represents 30 minutes, each night turn one hour. The vertical scale between contours is 30 feet.
Infantry and cavalry units are brigades, artillery units usually 16 gun battalions. A strength point of infantry or cavalry is 100 men. A gun point of artillery is roughly 3 cannons.[...]

Orders
Orders are the heart of the main command system of this game series. Players prepare orders in writing as instructions to the corps (generally) as to what they are to do. An order is not a hex by hex record of movement. It is the actual wording in the same form as the historical orders."

Re-implemented by:

    Thunder at the Crossroads: The Battle of Gettysburg, July 1-3, 1863  (Second Edition)

Name: Tricki
Description:
Goal: Become the most dexterous one moving 11 small wooden dowels, separating one thing at a time


     Select one out of 4 different games:
         Grab all of them, form a fist and try to drop one thing at a time
         Place all of them in your open hand and let them roll down, one dowel at a time 
         Put all of them between your 'Praying Hands' and drop one thing at a time, keeping your thumbs together
         Fix all of them horizontally between your hands and drop one dowel at a time
    


Scoring: 1st dowel +1, 2nd dowel +3, 3rd dowel + 5 etc.


       Fix 2 dowels with one hand in parallel and use the others to build up a pile - the higher the more you score



       Combine the four blue plastic rings with the dowels, creating a higher challenge for the dexterity of the participants

Name: War Kings
Description:
Card game that can be played in 3 versions.

From the creators:

"War Kings is a card game modeled after the ancient warring times by which the rules and principles of the game are adopted from thirteen chapters of Sun Tzu's Art of War. In War Kings, the crux of the thirteen chapters are gathered and fully utilized, the function of each card is designed based on these principles."

There are 3 ways to play War Kings:

1) War Kings - The Battle!
Involves playing cards to attack/defend. You have 4 lives. Every time you win a battle you win terrain. Win 4 terrain you win the game, or if all other players run out of lives before you, you win the game. People can team up on attacks/defense
2) War Kings - The Duel!
Kind of like a complex version of war; cards battle with various cards having different effects on the battle.
3) War Kings - Enemy Attacks!
Rummy variant; want to run out of cards first and score points for cards played.

The first game can be played by 3 to 6 players utilizing the one game deck.  The second game can be played by two using two separately purchased decks.  The third game is a simpler game that can be played by 2 to 6 players.

The cards feature artwork, Chinese characters, and English text.

Name: MILITARIA: Military History Quiz Game
Description:
The game is a card game on Military History, where six questions are on the one side of a card and the appropriate answers on the back side. The questions are colorcoded into six categories:

1. Up to 1200 A.D.
2. The 18th and 19th Centuries 
3. Naval History 
4. Aviation History 
5. Personalities 
6. General Knowledge

There are three ways to play MILITARIA (from the box):
1. The cards can be used purely as a reference for a Military History Quiz with questions chosen at random.
2. Each player can attempt to answer all the questions on one card for 1 point each. Should they reach a certain level of correct answers on this card, then they continue their turn by answering the next card also. 
3. The cards can be used in conjunction with any comparable TRIVIAL game.

The box contains 200 cards with 6 questions each.

Name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Conflict at the Carrock
Description:
Game description from the publisher:

Conflict at the Carrock is the second Adventure Pack in the Shadows of Mirkwood cycle for The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game. Hot on the trail of Gollum, the heroes venture down the banks of the Anduin, only to hear whispers of a new threat looming.

Conflict at the Carrock contains 60 fixed cards from the Shadows of Mirkwood cycle, continuing the heroes' quest to find and apprehend the creature Gollum. A new hero joins the quest, along with three copies of nine new player cards from all four spheres, a new deck of Encounter cards, and the Conflict at the Carrock Quest cards.

A variety of new player cards offer exciting deck-building options, featuring new and familiar faces. Frodo Baggins is beginning to feel restless in the Shire while the Beorning Beekeepers offer their assistance to anyone willing to help drive the troublesome Trolls away. A Long-beard Mapmaker discovers a hidden Dúnedain Warning that just might help the heroes avoid defeat.
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: The Lord of the Rings – The Card Game (LCG)

Name: Wer knackt die Nuß
Description:
Goal: Form a sentence from randomly drawn letters and a 'theme'-card, as quick as possible.

Build up the board - distribute the letters onto the coloured spaces

1. Draw a 'theme'-card out of different fields of topics
2. Use a six-sided coloured die and pick up corresponding letters
3. Form a sentence (simultaneously) , which must refer to the 'theme'-card - the faster the better, because only the first one scores;

Name: Irish Wolf
Description:
Irish Wolf is a betting card game for 3 to 4 players.

The game consists of 25 cards (5 each in five different colors and values from 1 to 5) showing a figure of a greyhound, 25 tokens (5 each in five different colors), and chips (e.g., 20 of value 1 and 20 of value 5). The game is about racing with greyhounds and its progress can be influenced by the cards each player plays. To begin, the cards are shuffled and distributed to all players. The remaining cards are placed on the matching color group, causing the greyhound of this color to take the lead in the race. Thereafter, all players play a card from their hand and the greyhounds then move forward according to the number on the respective cards. Players use their tokens to wager on a greyhound of their choice. The game ends when no tokens remain of one color. Players receive chips according to their tokens of the same color as the winning dogs. The player with the most chips wins.

Originally published in spielbox 1992 #1.

Name: Dragons of Kir: Warlords
Description:
The Warlords expansion for Dragons of Kir enables three or four players to play what was previously a two-player game.  It includes 3-4p instructions, as well as the following wooden pieces:

     4 wooden towers (1 for each player, each in a different color of wood) to act as "war tents"
     4 wooden blocks with dragons wood-burned into them to act as the player pawns
     1 wooden block with a dragon wood-burned into it, which acts as the start player token


The last war tent standing wins!

Additionally, three-player cutthroat rules are included.

Name: Bodensee-Reise
Description:
Pick up as many as possible 'sight-seeing' markers and souvenirs.
All the players have the same starting place - Lindau.
Depending on your amount of luck - and collecting a bonus for
being the first one who finishes the race - you are going to win.

1. Rotationally you travel along the red route - broken or continous line - as many stations as points diced with your meeple
2. You also may choose the blue (sea)line - you may switch from one to the other at any place where the lines meet
3. If your meeple lands in 'marked' cities - someting happens, depending on the color of the city - picking up souvenirs etc.
4. Meeting another player you are going to be invited getting a present (=souvenir)
5. First player who arrives back in Lindau receives 5 additional souvenirs
6. The winner is the one who has collected the most souvenirs, after all players have returned from the trip

Name: Death Ride Kursk: 3rd Panzer
Description:
This game is an Expansion for Death Ride Kursk - Gross Deutschland.  Ownership of DRK-GD is required in order to play this game.  This will be the second in the series of games that simulate the battle to eliminate the Kursk Salient.  This game is an expansion game and players must own DRK-GD in order to play this game.  The 3rd Panzer Division held the left flank of XLVIII Panzer Korps and plays a major role in the crossing of the Pena River and keeping the pressure off the Gross Deutschland Divisions left flank so they can push north to Oboyan and Kursk.   This game expands the order of battle by 1 Panzer and 1 Infantry Division, 1 Tank Corps, and a Rifle Division.  Most of the maps from DRK-GD are reused in this game and an additional (4) 11" x 17" map sections are added along with about 500 additional unit counters and markers.

Death Ride Kursk - 3rd Panzer is GSI's second offering on the Eastern Front. The game focuses on tactical level combat and maneuver during the German attack at Kursk in July 1943.

The game features the 3rd Panzer Division and some supporting XLVIII Panzer Corps units at mostly Platoon and some Company/Battery level and the Red Army (10th Tank Corps, and other rifle and supporting elements) at Company/Battery level. The combat system utilizes combat multipliers that players must use correctly to have the best effect. Each hex is 330 meters.  Turns are 2 hours long during the day and 4 hours at night.   The rules are modeled around the seven battlefield operating systems which make them easily understood and easy to learn.  Unlike other games at this level the rules are not massive.  This system features extensive use of obstacles (mines, wire, improved positions, and fortifications), a patrol rule, overwatch fire, air and artillery support, and reserve movement.  These obstacles help channel the attack and force the Germans into kill sacks and forcing them to push through the heavy resistance to take ground.  Overwatch is a type of fire that allows the player to move a short distance and then setup to fire suppressive fire at enemy units that might otherwise use opportunity fire.  Reserve movement will allow a player to respond to enemy movement and move more units into a hex to strengthen it before an assault.  Units are modeled to represent the 2 major types of weapons that most units have.  Secondary (usually small arms) and a primary (main gun, machine guns, etc...).  These weapons may fire at different targets if they want.  They also effect targets differently.   Suppression is also handled uniquely in this game.  Units that are suppressed get a defense bonus since they take better advantage of the terrain in the hex, while at the same time they have their other factors reduced.  Units are also modeled as needing transports and get the benefits of movement from them with the vulnerability that goes with it.  The battle follows the divisions actions during the 10 days of the battle.   The division operated on the left flank of the Gross Deutschland Division.   The additional armor in this game makes play extremely fun and intense and they include Panzer Regiment 6 (90 MkIII and IV tanks) and 10th Tank Corps 3 Tank Brigades (120 T34 and 60 T70 tanks).  3rd Panzer has its 2 Infantry Regiments and supporting elements.  The game will also force players to account for Command and Control and Supply.   Maintenance and repair are critical to both sides as this determines most of the replacements that arrive every morning.  Troop replacements are generated by returning casualties to the battle.  Lots of these casualties are minor in nature and both sides worked hard to get these wounded back to the front quickly.  Air-Ground Attack can have a significant effect on the battle and both sides have a capability in the air to affect the battle.  The Germans were eventually bled white and forced to suspend Citadel.

This 3rd Panzer division game fits into the DRK-GD game framework by being primarily a reinforcement in that game and replacing the 3rd Panzer battalion counters that simply fill the void and help cover the extended left flank of GD.

3rd Panzer - comes with (in Full Color):

        (4) Map Sections of the Pena River Area of Operations (maps A1 to A4)
        Supplemental Rules Specific to 3rd Panzer
        Order of Battle Cards
        Task Organization Charts for Each Major German and Red Army Formation
        Approximately 1800 Unit Counters and Markers

Name: Boulder Greenbelt
Description:
Boulder Greenbelt is a game themed around life in the city of Boulder, Colorado. Spaces on the game board resemble actual places within the city and each space does something for or to the player akin to its real life counterpart.
At the beginning of the game players roll a die twice to determine their starting bankroll. This bankroll is not denoted by any type of token and is instead to be remembered in the players head or on paper. This is important as any player may contest a players bankroll at any time in the game and if it is found to be faulty that player suffers a punishment. Once all players have their bankroll play beings and each player rolls a die to move the indicated number of spaces and take the actions on the space on which they land.
A player wins when they achieve "Nirvanna" which can be achieved by a number of different means as they pass the 9th street bridge space.

Name: Simpel, aber genial
Description:
This game was published in spielbox 1992 #1.
Each player has an 8x8 fields paper sheet, on which they should write words, using one field pro letter. The first player says a word with 3 to 5 letters and all players write this word on their sheets, one letter pro field, but only the consonants! The fields corresponding to vocals are kept empty. One can write the word where and how will, from the left to the right or from above to below. After all players have written this word, the next player says his word and the game proceeds in this way. If a player is unable to write a next word, he is out of the game. The aim of the game is writing the words in such a way, trying to have the fewest empty fields. Naturally, the words will have no sense after the empty fields have been filled.

Name: Triade
Description:
Triade is an abstract game that is played on a board with 61 hexagonal spaces.

Each player starts with 31 pawns of a different color (e. g., one player will be white and the other will be black). On their turn, a player places a pawn on a empty space on the board. A player may continue to place pawns on the empty spaces that are neighbors to at least three of their own pieces. When this is no longer possible, it is the turn of their opponent. The game ends after a player has placed their last pawn. This player is the winner and receives an amount of points corresponding to the opponent’s remaining pawns. There is a game variant in which a player can choose between placing a pawn as described above or, alternatively, placing a pawn on a distant field, preventing its occupation by an opponent’s pawn.

Originally published in spielbox 1992 #2.

Name: Olympiade
Description:
In Olympiade, 2 to 4 players compete on 8 special boards representing the 10 disciplines of the Decathlon: On day 1, they compete in 100m, long jump, shot put, high jump, and 400m. On day 2, the disciplines are: 110m hurdles, discus throw, pole vault, javelin throw, and 1500m. Special dice, with red, green and blue faces, are used by the players to achieve their successful results in each discipline. The points on the red faces are valid for racing events, those on blue faces for jumping events, and the green faces for the launching events. Naturally, the winner, the super athlete, is the player with the most points at the end of the Decathlon.

Originally published in spielbox 1992 #3 for celebrating the 25th Olympic Games - Barcelona 1992.

Name: 4 Letter Word
Description:
A simple fast paced party game. Players use cards to build sets of four letter words.

Each player draws a card from the deck in an attempt to play a word. To play a word the player takes cards from his hand and places them face up covering the previous word to create a new one. The player can use as many cards as needed but Words may only consist of exactly four (4) letters and at least ONE letter must be used from the previous word.

Points are awarded the number of letters used and the complexity of the word.

Name: Bucket Brigade
Description:
A game for children. 4 is the ideal number of players.
Each player has set of five buckets which can be lifted by handles that fit under the rim, 5 marbles and a 'well'. The players each arrange their buckets in a row, one end of which touches the well.
Someone says "Go!", the player must lift the bucket closest to the well and tips the marble into the well. He returns the bucket , lifts the second one and tips the marble into the now empty first bucket. This procedure is repeated until the marble in the fifth bucket has been transferred into all the other buckets. The winner is the first player to get 5 marbles into the well.
Simple but will appeal to its age range. Adults should supervise because the youngest children might fancy eating a marble.

Name: In bocca al lupo
Description:
From the back of the box:

"What do you waitin' for? With "In bocca al lupo" (Good luck in Italian) you can live with your friends all the fun of the TV program that entertains millions of TV viewers! Playing with "In bocca al lupo" it's easy and fun. The game is divided in a series of trials, each giving a prize in "Golden Tokens". To win you have to uncover the "Black Sheep", to guess the "Mysterious Word", to be "Beware of the Wolf" meanwhile you have to remember a sequence of names, to solve the "Gipsy"'s riddles without draw the black moon, to have star's lucky in the "Game of zodiac", and to find the winning ace in the final showdown "Two Versus All"".

It have cards, a wheel with an arrow, a wheel for the zodiac (it's static: 12 cards are drawn and put down around the wheel), block of papers and two book of riddles, good for ten plays.

Name: Euro: In viaggio per l'europa con la nuova moneta unica
Description:
From the back of the box:

"A trip across the EUROPE, both educational and fun, discovering of what will change with the introduction of the single currency. With a simple and gripping gameplay, you'll learn a lot of important notions, to be real EUROPE nationals and do the first shopping in EURO. Tailored for the whole family or group of friends who want to be prepared for this new important appointment."

Every player get an amount of money, and a "Travel Agency"; they use two pawns (one plastic, one cardboard with standup) one in a track where different things can happen, and one in a map of the European Union. Spinning the wheel, every player move the plastic pawn around the track, where it may get or lose money or tickets. Some special boxes on track are trivia boxes, and other are "Guess the price" trivia space: a player read from a quiz book a common object name, and the others must guess what price is in euro, putting the money on the "Travel Agency" and opening all at the same time. A square in the track is "Departure" where all players, using tickets (trains for a near country, boats are for countries connected by naval lines on the map, and planes are every non near coutry). After these moves, if there is only a pawn on a country, that player get a flag. If two or more are on that country, nobody gets that flag! Also, there are only three flag; when they are out, the player don't get the flag. The first to collect 6 flags wins.
  
The game has playing board, rulesbook, triviabook, various pawns, 6 "Travel Agency" player's screen to hide information, flags, tickets and cardboard Euro money.

Name: Huggermugger Mystery Wheel Sports Edition
Description:
This is an expansion of the original Huggermugger game of 1989

The wheel in this game is intended to be used as an accessory when playing HUGGERMUGGER, the 'Mystery Word' Game.

Name: Dust Tactics: Operation "Cyclone"
Description:
Game description from the publisher:

A rich mine of VK has been discovered in the subzero wastes of Antarctica, and its direct access to the sea makes it a dangerous new focal point of the war. As the Axis forces fortify their defenses on the icy shores, the Allies plan a swift and daring amphibious assault in the hopes of claiming the enemy position...

Operation "Cyclone" is an exciting new campaign expansion for Dust Tactics, the tactical miniatures board game of explosive battlefield combat!

Operation "Cyclone" brings the fight from Antarctica's frozen waterways to its icy shores. With an exciting scenario guide including eight new battles, as well as the supplemental rules for artillery, amphibious assaults, and more, Operation Cyclone includes everything you need to expand your Dust Tactics experience!

Also included in Operation "Cyclone" are six new terrain tiles, four ammo crates, four tank traps, nine terrain squares, and two amazing new heroes!

Name: All Wrapped Up!
Description:
This is a memory game for children age 4 and older. The players travel around the board collecting gifts. The cards matching each gift are placed in a plastic rack in front of the child... but the kids turn the cards away so only the other players can actually see the images.

The first player to collect seven gift cards and name them correctly in the proper order wins the game.

Includes a colorful board, 4 plastic racks, 4 tokens, 33 cards, a die, and the rules. No reading is required to play... the cards have images and descriptions but the kids can just remember the pictures.

Name: Clonk!
Description:
"10 lively action games for one or more players"

A collection of 10 games played using the plastic "flickers" and "pucks" where you must flick the discs into various areas of the box insert. Sometimes into the coloured areas through the small gates or other parts of the scoring surface.

Games lists in the rules are -

Simplex
Colour Box
Form Fours
Colour Fours
Vicious Circle
Spider
Rainbow
Shepherd
Yellow Peril
Fairway

Rules are in English and French.

Name: E.C.W. D.B.A.
Description:
This is a set of miniatures wargame rules for refighting the english civil war.

The rules set is a derivative of WRG's DBA rules. The smallest unit is a "stand" containing multiple models as opposed to handling individual figures.

The emphasis of the rules is quick-play. Combat is resolved by the roll of two standard dice, and movement is controled by a single die roll for "Command Points".

Name: Drôles de Mamans
Description:
The goal of the game is to collect and assemble parts of moms

the tiles represent moms in different colors and style.
Each mom is split in 3 parts (head, body and legs).

All the tiles are shuffled face down, this is the board.

Like in Memory we must remember were the tiles you want are, and you collect them to build hilarious moms.

Name: Monopoly: Seine-Saint-Denis
Description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the  Seine-Saint-Denis, in France.

Name: E=M6 le jeu
Description:
Close to Pandemic, with an environmental theme.

In this cooperative game, players face five major crises (melting north pole, ocean pollution, deforestation, air pollution and human impact) and attempt to save the Planet.

Players must plan their strategy together to stop these crises.

There is no specialists, but players draw a number of cards depending of their location, they can travel and use their cards as abilities to cure crisis.

It's an educational themed game to educate children about environmental issues.

Name: Railway Rivals Map RO: Romania
Description:
Railway Rivals Map R - Romania

This is an expansion map for Railway Rivals.  All players start in Bucuresti 11/12.  Every fourth run is an International Run as follows:
1 = Bulgaria... 6 Any Port

Map designed by Fred King, Printed by Ryoda

Name: In ze boite
Description:
Game from the TV show of the same name on Gulli.

Two teams compete in different fun and educational tests (mime, quizz, songs) to earn time for the final.

for the final, teams confronte "the black box" with the time they earn during the first step of the game.
each team lead a blindness member who try to take some cubes from the box.

Name: Hans Christian Andersen's Thumbelina Game
Description:
From the back of the box:

Will you get to the wedding on time?  Follow your heart and nothing is impossible!

A simple set of rules, short duration of play and bright illustrations offer excitement and fun for young Thumbelina fans.  With the added surprise of chance cards, children learn to identify pictures and colors while enjoying the fantasy world of Thumbelina and her charming prince, Cornelius.

Object: Try to be the first player to get to Thumbelina's wedding.

On your turn, roll the color die and move to the first space that matches the color rolled.  If there is another player on that space, that player must go back to the start.

If you roll white, take the top chance card.  Find the matching picture on the board and move to the space beside it.  Sometimes this will enable you to jump ahead, but other times you will have to move backwards.

To win you must land on the orange space at the end of the trail and you must roll orange to do so.

Name: MelodieXpress Rhythm Deck
Description:
The MelodieXpress Rhythm Deck provides a sneak peak at the next expansion for the MelodieXpress family of games. The 52 card deck showcases some of the new cards available.

Rhythm Deck Contents
The MelodieXpress Rhythm Deck includes playing cards based around music notation as the basis for games and activities. The deck includes cards for a range of notes –quavers, crotchets, semibreves and minims; dotted crotchets and dotted semibreves; along with doublet and triplet crotchets and doublet, triplet and quadruplet quavers. It also includes the corresponding rests for quaver, crotchet, semibreve and minim.

The card designs differ from the earlier decks. As the cards focus upon elements of rhythm, the notes are depicted on a plain background without staff lines. This allows players to visually focus upon the individual note values rather than positioning against the staff to discern the pitch of the notes.

Games
The MelodieXpress Rhythm Deck provides a set of cards only. The cards may be used with the games from the MelodieXpress Note Reading and Composing Music packs. ‘Snap’, ‘Memory’, ‘Rows’ and ‘Rhythm Lunch’ all work well with this deck – though the players focus upon matching the note duration rather than its pitch.

Next Steps
This deck provides fans with an early look at some of the cards which will be used in the upcoming MelodieXpress Rhythm Pack. This will include a further 150+ cards which can be integrated with this Rhythm Deck, along with a 16 page game guide.

The MelodieXpress System
MelodieXpress is a fun, educational and easy way to learn to read music. Using the approach that we learn best through play, MelodieXpress uses games and activities to introduce the key concepts of musical notation and music theory. This step-by-step approach allows you to learn at your own pace, while the games provide an enjoyable way to learn and consolidate your knowledge of music.

Name: Q•bitz 100 Card Expansion Pack
Description:
Q•bitz 100 Card Expansion Pack includes exactly what it says in the title. For those not familiar with Q•bitz, here's a rundown of game play:

In Q•bitz players use their special blocks to recreate patterns, claim cards and win the game.

In the first round, someone reveals a Q•bitz card (out of a deck of 100 cards), then players race to assemble their specially colored blocks in the pattern shown on that card; the first player to do so claims the card. In the second round, players must roll their blocks like dice to find the iamges that they need to recreate the pattern on the card. In the third round, all players look at the card for ten seconds to try to memorize the pattern, then they work on recreating that pattern by memory; the round ends when someone calls for it to end, with the player who successfully recreated more of the pattern than anyone else claiming the card.

After three sets of three rounds, the player who claimed the most cards wins the game.

Expands game: Qâ€¢bitz

Name: Valkampanj
Description:
Card game with no luck where each player plays with either hearts, spades, clubs or diamonds. So each player has a set of 13 cards, and each set has the same value. The players clockwise play a card and try to win sticks, but the sticks are individually not worth the same amount of points. The first stick is worth 1 point + 1 point for every card played in this stick. The winner of the second stick receives 2 points for the stick + 1 point for every card in that stick and so on. When one player plays his last card it is the last stick, and thereafter the results are calculated.

This card game was invented by Dan Glimne in 1991 inspired by the Swedish parliament elections at that time. It was published in his book Nya spel (1994) and later also in Kortspelshandboken (2005) and Lilla Korstspelshandboken (2006).

Name: The Ben Johnson Dope Game
Description:
Card game where each player is a runner in a 100 meter race. The cards (ordinary deck of 52 cards) are shuffled and each player receives 13 cards face down. The players now look at them and sort out 4 cards and from these 4 cards he decides whether to use 1,2,3 or all 4 of them to use in the race. They are used to determine the result of the player. Spades are not allowed to use among these 4 cards. They are instead among the the rest of the cards (9 cards) which are placed face down in front of the player. If a player accuses another player for being doped, he then chooses to look at one (or maybe 2 or up to 4 cards depending on how many cards the player used for the race) of his 9 face down cards, and if any of these cards is a spade, the player is doped and disqualified.

This card game was invented by Dan Glimne in 1988 inspired by  Ben Johnson´s Olympic doping scandal at that time. It was published in Spielbox magazine (1989), Games Review Monthly (1989), Dan Glimne book, Nya Spel (1994) and later also in Kortspelshandboken (2005) and Lilla Korstspelshandboken (2006).  It was also published in a Swedish Daily Newspaper (1988).

Name: The Touch:  Farm Animals Expansion Pack
Description:
Expansion for The Touch

In The Touch, plastic playing pieces (landmarks such as the Eiffel tower, objects such as a roller skate or a hamburger) are placed inside a plastic dome while cards containing sets of these figures (i.e. "Paris Landmarks") are placed around the dome.  In turn, players will place their hand in the dome and attempt to locate (by feel only) pieces matching those pictured on the card that was overturned.  Points are awarded for pieces drawn and sets collected with victory going to the player earning the most points.

The Farm Animal Expansion adds a new themed set of 12 pieces (cow, horse, goat...) and 6 cards to add variety to the base game.  The base game is required in order to use this expansion.

Name: TOP
Description:
Avoid to spend the most valuable tokens of your collection for building 'waste pyramids', because the remaining ones are going to score

1 place your - different sized - tokens on the board corresponding to the roll of three dice; chose the most favourable one to build a back-up-system for your more precious tokens
2 form 'waste pyramids' (all together) to reduce the supply of your opponents - also by the roll of three dice

Name: Genesis
Description:
In Genesis, players build the surface of a new planet.

Each player receives a pen of a different color. The board is placed in the middle of the table. In the first phase, the players, alternately, put a mark of their color on a free space on the board in order to show their ownership. This phase lasts multiple rounds depending on the number of players (7 rounds for 2 players, 5 for 3 players, 4 rounds for 4-5 players, and 3 rounds for 6 players. In the next phase, each player, on their turn, chooses a direction and expands their landscape in the chosen direction. The game ends when all spaces have been filled. The player who has occupied the least amount of spaces receives zero points. The other players receive points corresponding to the difference between the number of spaces they occupied and the number of spaces the last player has. The player with the most points wins.

Originally published in spielbox 1992 #4.

Name: Linea
Description:
In Linea, two players duel on a special board of 12 round spaces linked by 12 lines. On their turn, the player places one of their pieces, numbered 1 through 6, on an open space. The aim of the game is to dominate the majority of the 12 lines that connect the spaces. A line is considered dominated if the sum of the spaces of a player’s pieces on the line is higher than that of the opponents. When all spaces are occupied, the game ends.

Originally published in spielbox 1992 #4.

Reimplemented by:


    Stonehenge

Name: The Game of Trianhole
Description:
A ball/marble rolling game published in the 1920s by Glevum Games.

It has at least three printings, one with the company name and wooden balls, one with the trademarked company name and logo(still with wooden balls) and a later printing with glass marbles and a different scoring target.

Early version used wooden balls and had 13 scoring holes numbered from 5 to 50 - (1x5, 3x10, 2x15m 2x20, 2x25, 2x30, 1x50) as depicted on the box cover.

The later version used glass marbles and had 20 scoring holes (4 x 5 pattern) numbered 5 to 20 - (4x5, 8x10, 6x15, 2x20)

Play appears to be that each player (any number) rolls 4 balls towards the target and scores the total of the numbers where the balls settle.

Double points are awarded should a ball settle in a hole of the same colour as the ball.

Play stops when somebody reaches 100 points.

Name: Ascot
Description:
Ascot is a horse race betting game for 2 to 18 players.

The game consists of the game board (six racing lines – one for each horse, numbered columns, representing forwards or backwards movements), 6 horses in 6 different colors, 108 betting slips (each 18 in the colors of the horses), and 72 movement cards in a neutral color. For each horse, there are 12 cards (3x "+", 2x "++", 1x "+++", 3x "-", 2x "- -", and 1x "- - -"). The start position of each horse is the field of its respective line in the central column.

Each player receives six betting slips (one of each color) and an amount of the 72 movement cards (previously shuffled and distributed amongst them). The objective of the players is to give adequate movement cards to the player nominated as the game master in attempt to best influence the position of the horses during the race. Simultaneously, the players may change betting slips with each other, trying to achieve the best winnings. For that, the players are free to communicate among them and change both betting slips and movement cards. During the race, the players may give movement cards (face down) to the game master. After the game master plays five cards, they move the corresponding horses according to the played movement cards. The game ends after a predetermined number of rounds are played and the players receive points according to their bets. The player with the most points wins.

Originally published in spielbox 1992 #5.

Name: Flames of War: Dogs & Devils
Description:
Inside this supplement for Flames of War you will find the history of the Allied liberation of Italy from Messina to Rome.

Options to field a rifle company from the 3rd US Infantry Division, the Canadian and American First Special Service Force (the Devil's Brigade).

Options to field three different companies of the Hermann Goring Fallschirmpanzerdivision.  Options to field companies from the 362nd and 715th Infantry Divisions resurrected from the ashes of Stalingrad and re-equipped with the newest and best Germany has to offer.

Painting guides and color plates are provided for the forces covered by the rules.

There is also a scenario covering the key battle of Cisterna.

Name: Avalanche Fruit Stand
Description:
from game website

Are you steady enough to work at this fun fruit stand? Spin the wheel, then use the jumbo tweezers to pick or place fruit.  In Avalanche Fruit Stand players are stacking small fruit-figures on a pile with the goal to not be the one who causes it to tumble.

Includes 40 fruit counters (5 different fruits), 2 jumbo tweezers, picture spinner, and adjustable cardboard fruit stand/storage box measuring 6"L x 9.5"W x 13.75"H

Name: Prophet Search: Ezra Taft Benson
Description:
Objective:
To gain more knowledge of the life and personality of the prophet.

To play each player takes a game card, and as questions about the Prophet Ezra Taft Benson are shared.  Players who have the answer on their game card put a marker on that spot.  First one to have four markers in a row wins.

Name: Sein Letzter Dollar
Description:
Goal: Collect as many chips as possible before 1st player goes bankrupt

1. Each player receives 10 wooden chips 
2. Place your 'chip-team' by rolling three dice into your own area
3. Prepare your team to challenge your opponents - roll the dice if you win ==> rolling a '6', you may collect set chips
4. If you own only one last chip (=letzter Dollar) you may play 'all or nothing'

Name: Colonies and Conquest: Asia 1494–1698 – Field of Glory Renaissance Gaming Companion
Description:
This supplement contains lists for Asian and African armies during the period covered by the Field of Glory Renaissance rules, 1494 - 1698. The following armies are covered:

MING CHINESE
KOREAN
JAPANESE
JAPANESE WARRIOR MONK ALLIES
IKKO IKKI
MONGOL
TIBETAN
MUSLIM INDIAN
HINDU INDIAN
INDONESIAN OR MALACCAN
THAI, BURMESE AND KHMER
VIETNAMESE
DESERT BEDOUIN
SETTLED ARAB STATES
ETHIOPIAN
ZANJ
HORN OF AFRICA
MAORI AND PACIFIC ISLAND CULTURES
HAWAIIAN
COLONIAL PORTUGUESE
MUGHAL
WOKOU PIRATES
JURCHEN, LATER JIN AND QING
COLONIAL DUTCH
MARATHA

The book itself is in the same format as the earlier supplements. It contains 108 pages with historical backgrounds for each list together with photos of miniatures and illustrations from Osprey books

Name: Tower of London
Description:
Goal: Be the first to reach your inner circled areas with all of your tokens (alike Pachisi)


     You start within your coloured area at the outer range  with 4 tokens (each of the tribes are named - from dark to bright: Normans, Anglo-Saxons, Britons and Picts & Scotti).
     Roll the three dices and allocate numbers to appropriate tokens - you may add up, too. Rolling doubles enables you to roll the dice again.
     Follow up the arrows

Name: dabong!
Description:
2 - 5 players take turns laying down cards in a central pile. Instead of the basic suits found in a standard deck of cards, dabong! uses Earth, Wind, Water, and Fire.

The most common way a player lays down a card is by matching the suit or number of the card in the pile to a card in the player's hand. However, there are additional options to play the players can play cards of the same suit that add up to the number in the middle. For example, if a 10 of Fire is in the central pile, a player could play a 2, a 3, and a 5 of Water all at the same time.

A player wins when he/she has used all of his/her cards, or through a dabong! A dabong occurs when a players cards add up to the central card, regardless of suit.

Name: Master Imagem
Description:
Translated from the box:
"Master Imagem is a game of question and answers which involves knowledge, luck and perception. There are 1800 questions divided in 6 subjects and your team can chose one of them and answer before the time ended.
Getting a right answer your team opens a door of the chosen theme and see a word or part of the mysterious figure. But if you are wrong, the next team gets a shot.
Collect more tips and risk a guess 'What?', 'Where?' or 'Who' is the mystery picture."

Name: Timopoly
Description: This Monopoly clone is themed with Canadian-based Tim Horton's "coffee and bake shops".  Players buy and sell the restaurant's most popular items.  Player tokens include (among others) a coffee cup, a donut, and a "Zamboni" ice resurfacing machine.  (Tim Horton was a famous NHL hockey player).

Name: La Battaglia delle Falkland
Description:
A boardgame about the would-be Battle of the Falkland, designed in Spring 1982 while the British fleet was approaching the Argentina-occupied islands and the battle was still to be engaged. Published with some delay (because of a strike at the publishing house) on the Italian news magazine "Il Mondo" of the 4th of May, just while the battle raged.
A simplified aero-naval simulation boardgame, with the classical hex-grid map and square counters.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Supermundial
Description:
Soccer simulation published on the 5th of July, 1982 by the Italian weekly newsmagazine Panorama. Counters cover all the teams taking part in the World Cup in these same days.
The game is a classical simulation with hex-grid map, counters with attack and movement scores, charts for the results of confrontations and actions. The attack points have been awarded by a pool of famed Italian sport journalists.

Name: Игросказ
Description:
From publisher:

Storyteller is a good workout for beginning storytellers. Making up stories is one of the most exciting activities in the world. It doesn’t matter whether it’s a campfire story or a $200 million blockbuster movie. There is only one winner in Storyteller but every player takes away an amazing prize - a unique story that they all created together.

The game set for Storyteller contains 200 cards which are divided into two different types: plot and ending cards. Plot cards contain elements of the future story: the heroes, places, objects, events and other characteristics. Each ending card has a final sentence for the story written on them. When developing a story, the players illustrate it by taking plot cards from their hands and placing them onto the table. As the game progresses, players take turns telling the story. Each player is trying to steer the tale in a direction that would ultimately fit their ending card. Since the ending cards are all quite different, each player will attempt to tailor the story in a different way, causing the plot to take notorious twists and turns.

Name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – That Which Consumes Asylum Pack
Description:
Game description from the publisher:

That Which Consumes is the sixth and final exciting Asylum Pack in The Rituals of the Order expansion cycle for Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game. It introduces three copies each of 20 never-before-seen cards to the vibrant Call of Cthulhu metagame, expanding the deck-building options of all factions, including the new Order of the Silver Twilight faction.

The sudden surprise of the ground giving way is the theme of That Which Consumes, in which a variety of new event and support cards will be introduced into the arsenal of each faction. From Hastur's Final Note which destroys all insane characters, to Yog-Sothoth's A Gift of Knowledge which trades wounds for success tokens, That Which Consumes will keep your opponents guessing what explosive event will come next.

With the element of surprise looming dangerously, no one is safe from That Which Consumes!
